page.title: 09Farming-Commercial-Bructor
page.content: Bructor farm is run in conjunction with a neighbouring farm - Coutens. Together they cover 400 acres and are farmed by Mr E. Booth and his grandson Mr E. Simmers. The chief enterprise is fattening cattle of which they own 400. Until 10 years ago Bructor had been a dairy farm retailing milk to the nearby town of Oldmeldrum, but due to increasing production costs changed to fattening cattle for beef. Approximately half the land is used for growing barley which if of an adequate standard goes for malting to be made into whisky. If the grain is not of an acceptable standard then it is sold as cattle fodder. Mr Booth employs three men on his farm besides his grandson, two tractormen and one cattleman.
